problem:
Let $\mathbf{a}$ be a unit vector.  Compute
\[\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{i}\|^2 + \|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{j}\|^2 + \|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{k}\|^2.\]
solution:
Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{pmatrix}.$  Since $\mathbf{a}$ is a unit vector, $x^2 + y^2 + z^2 = 1.$

Also,
\[\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{i}\|^2 = \left\| \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{pmatrix} \times \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = \left\| \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ z \\ -y \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = y^2 + z^2.\]Similarly,
\[\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{j}\|^2 = \left\| \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{pmatrix} \times \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = \left\| \begin{pmatrix} -z \\ 0 \\ x \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = x^2 + z^2,\]and
\[\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{k}\|^2 = \left\| \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{pmatrix} \times \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = \left\| \begin{pmatrix} y \\ -x \\ 0 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2 = x^2 + y^2.\]Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{i}\|^2 + \|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{j}\|^2 + \|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{k}\|^2 &= (y^2 + z^2) + (x^2 + z^2) + (x^ 2 + y^2) \\
&= 2(x^2 + y^2 + z^2) = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}
